title: Na-adjective + そう (静かそう) not recognized
description:
## Problem

静かそう (looks quiet) shows no chain. The そう suffix handler looks for Continuative/Adjective Stem forms, but na-adjectives don't have that conjugation type in the DB.

## Current Output
  静かそう → (none)

## Expected
  静かそう → 静か (quiet) → そう (looks like)

## Root Cause

The _handler_sou() calls find_word_with_conj_type(root, 13, CONJ_ADJECTIVE_STEM, CONJ_ADVERBIAL). For na-adjectives, the root is 静か but this doesn't appear as a conjugated form of anything — na-adj stems ARE the root form. The handler needs to also accept na-adjectives directly (POS='adj-na').

高そう works because 高い is an i-adjective and 高 appears as the adj stem (conj_type=51). 静か has no such conjugation.

## Fix Approach

In _handler_sou(), after the conjugation check, also try:
  results.extend(find_word_with_pos(session, root, 'adj-na'))

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:468 - _handler_sou()
- himotoki/suffixes.py:228 - sou registration

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '静かそう'
  python -m himotoki -f '高そう'  # This works (i-adj)

description:
## Problem
The explanatory ん (contracted の) in patterns like したいんです, 食べるんだ, いるんじゃない is tagged as [int] (interjection) instead of being identified as a nominalizer particle.

## Affected entries
#261, #290, #375, #377, and others with んだ/んです patterns.

## How to Verify
python scripts/check_segments.py 261
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore 261
close_reason: Systemic issue - ん entry (seq 2139720) has interjection glosses before particle glosses. Needs POS reordering or context-aware pattern matching.

title: Counter expressions show no conjugation chain - by design
description:
## Not a Bug - Documentation

Counter expressions like 三匹, 五人, 二冊 show no conjugation chain because they are not conjugated words. They are number + counter combinations.

## Patterns (working correctly)

- 三匹 (3 animals) -> sanbiki, correctly identified counter
- 五人 (5 people) -> gonin, correctly identified
- 二冊 (2 books) -> nisatsu, correctly identified
- 何回 (how many times) -> nankai, correctly identified

These are handled by the counter system (himotoki/counters.py), not the conjugation/suffix system. They don't have conjugation chains because counters don't conjugate.

The only potential enhancement would be showing "number + counter" decomposition in the output, but this is not a conjugation chain issue.

No action needed. This issue is for documentation/tracking only.

## How it works
  python -m himotoki -f '三匹'
  # Output: sanbiki  三匹 【さんびき】 counter for small animals -- correct
notes: Counter expressions are correctly handled by the counter system. No conjugation chain needed.

title: mi suffix not registered (深み, 甘み, 重み, 暖かみ)
description:
## Problem

Adjective み-nominalization shows no grammar chain. The み suffix is NOT registered in suffixes.py.

## Failing Patterns

- 深み (depth) -> dict entry, no chain: 深い + み
- 甘み (sweetness) -> dict entry, no chain: 甘い + み
- 重み (weight/importance) -> dict entry, no chain: 重い + み
- 暖かみ (warmth) -> dict entry, no chain: 暖かい + み

## Root Cause

み as an adjective nominalizer is not in the suffix system. It converts i-adjectives to nouns by replacing the trailing い with み:
- 深い -> 深み
- 甘い -> 甘み
- 重い -> 重み
- 暖かい -> 暖かみ

All these words exist as JMdict entries, so they get parsed as standalone dict entries.

## Fix Approach

1. Register mi suffix in init_suffixes():
   Find JMdict seq for み (nominalization suffix)
   _load_conjs(session, 'mi', SEQ_MI)

2. Add handler _handler_mi() that:
   - Root ends with adj stem (drop い -> adj stem + み)
   - find_word_with_conj_type(root, CONJ_ADJECTIVE_STEM)

3. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'mi': '-ness / depth of feeling (adjective nominalization)'

4. Will also need dict-entry-hides-compound fix (himotoki-i346) since all mi-words are also dict entries.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration needed
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_MI

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '深み'
  python -m himotoki -f '甘み'
  python -m himotoki -f '暖かみ'

title: naosu compound verb suffix not registered (食べなおす = to redo)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + 直す (to redo, to do again) is a productive compound verb suffix not registered in the suffix system.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べなおす (eat again) -> SPLITS as 食べ + な + おす (badly misparsed!)
- 書き直す (rewrite) -> dict entry, no chain
- やり直す (redo) -> dict entry, no chain

## Root Cause

直す (naosu: to redo) is not registered as a suffix. When there's no dict entry, the word gets misparsed (食べなおす splits as 食べ+な+おす because なおす overlaps with the negative な).

When there IS a dict entry (書き直す), no compound chain is shown (same dict-hides-compound issue).

## Fix Approach

1. Register naosu as suffix with continuative attachment:
   naosu_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_NAOSU, 'なおす')
   _load_kf('ren', naosu_kf, suffix_class='naosu')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'naosu': 'to do again / to redo / to fix'

3. For dict entries, also needs himotoki-i346 fix.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_NAOSU (直す seq)

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べなおす'
  python -m himotoki -f '書き直す'
  python -m himotoki -f 'やり直す'

title: wasureru compound verb suffix not registered (食べ忘れる = forget to)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + 忘れる (to forget to do) as a compound verb suffix is not registered.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べ忘れる (forget to eat) -> SPLITS as 食べ + 忘れる (2 words, no compound)
- 言い忘れる (forget to say) -> dict entry, no chain

## Root Cause

忘れる (wasureru: to forget) as a compound suffix is not registered. It attaches to the verb continuative stem. When there's no dict entry, it splits as 2 separate words. When there IS a dict entry (言い忘れる), no chain is shown.

Note: 忘れる is primarily a standalone verb. As a compound suffix, it means "to forget to do X". This is somewhat productive but less grammaticalized than suffixes like 始める or 続ける.

## Fix Approach

Register wasureru as compound verb suffix, similar to 始める, 終わる, 続ける:
  wasureru_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_WASURERU, 'わすれる')
  _load_kf('ren', wasureru_kf, suffix_class='wasureru')

SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION: 'wasureru': 'to forget to do ...'

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_WASURERU

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べ忘れる'
  python -m himotoki -f '言い忘れる'

title: Fix とも particle splitting
description:
## Issue

Himotoki incorrectly splits the particle とも into と+も.

## Example

**Sentence**: たとえ世界中が反対しようとも私は私の信念を貫き通すつもりだ

### Segmentation Comparison

| Ichiran | Himotoki |
|---------|----------|
| たとえ | たとえ |
| 世界中 | 世界中 |
| が | が |
| 反対しよう | 反対しよう |
| **とも** | **と** |
| 私 | **も** |
| は | 私 |
| ... | は ... |

## Expected Behavior

とも should be kept together as a single particle meaning 'even if' when following volitional form.

## Reference

See ichiran-source-code for how this pattern is handled.

title: Na-adjective te-form (静かで) not recognized
description:
## Problem

静かで (na-adj te-form: quiet and...) shows no chain. Na-adjective conjugation via copula で (te-form of だ) is not displayed.

## Current Output
  静かで → (none)

## Expected
  静かで → 静か (quiet, na-adj) + で (te-form of copula だ)

## Root Cause

Na-adjective conjugation goes through the copula だ. The forms だった (past), じゃない (negative), なら (conditional) all work because they have distinct entries. But で alone is ambiguous - it's also the particle で (at/in/by).

The parser likely matches で as the particle rather than the copula te-form.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/lookup.py - copula conjugation handling
- himotoki/segment.py - disambiguation of で

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '静かで'
  python -m himotoki -f '静かだった'  # This works

title: Connectors (ので, から, けど, のに) parsed as multi-word - documentation
description:
## Not a Bug - Documentation

Sentence connectors like ので, から, けど, のに are correctly parsed as separate words (particles/conjunctions) after the verb. This is the expected behavior.

## Patterns (all working correctly)

- 食べるので -> 食べる + ので (2 words) -- correct
- 食べるから -> 食べる + から (2 words) -- correct
- 食べるけど -> 食べる + けど (2 words) -- correct
- 食べるのに -> 食べる + のに (2 words) -- correct

These are NOT suffixes in the morphological sense. They are separate grammatical particles/conjunctions that follow the verb in its plain form. The parser correctly identifies them as separate words.

No action needed. This issue is for documentation/tracking only.

## How it works
  python -m himotoki -f '食べるから'
  # Output: 食べる (eat) + から (because) -- correct 2-word parse
notes: Connectors (ので, から, etc.) are correctly parsed as separate particles. No action needed.

title: Systemic: よ particle tagged as adj stem of いい
description:
## Problem
Sentence-ending particle よ is tagged with conj_type=Adjective Stem and source_text=いい. This is wrong; よ is a sentence-final particle [prt].

title: Systemic: compound verbs have empty POS arrays
description:
## Problem
Compound verb segments (e.g. 思っている, 言ってくれれば, 進めてください) consistently have empty POS arrays []. The POS should reflect the verb type and conjugation structure.

## Scale
Affects 104 of 172 failing entries — the single largest issue category.

## Example entries
#51, #83, #106, #117, #213, #417, #446, #466, #486, #498

## Root Cause
When compound verbs are formed from base verb + auxiliary (te-form + iru/shimau/kureru/etc.), the output POS array is empty. Need to propagate POS from the base verb to the compound segment.

## How to Verify
python scripts/check_segments.py 51
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore 51
notes: Fixed by adding word_info_from_word_match() in output.py to create component WordInfo objects with full POS/gloss data for compound verbs

title: 食べなくちゃ (must eat, contraction) shows empty chain
description:
## Problem

食べなくちゃ (must eat, contraction of 食べなくては) shows an empty chain.

## Current Output
  食べなくちゃ → └─ (empty)

## Expected
  食べなくちゃ → ← 食べる → なくちゃ (must do, contraction)

## Root Cause

The abbreviation handler _handler_abbr_nakereba() reconstructs root + なければ and calls find_word_full(). For なくちゃ, ABBREVIATION_STEMS['nakereba'] = 4, so it removes 4 chars from the root's ない form... but なくちゃ contracts from なくては, not なければ.

Actually なくちゃ is registered separately alongside なきゃ:
  _load_abbr('nakereba', 'なきゃ')
  _load_abbr('nakereba', 'なくちゃ')

The handler appends なければ to the root. Root for 食べなくちゃ with stem=4: 食べなくちゃ has 6 chars, stem removes 4 from ない → root=食べ... then 食べ+なければ = 食べなければ. But find_word_full may not find this.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:549 - _handler_abbr_nakereba()
- himotoki/suffixes.py:295 - ABBREVIATION_STEMS
- himotoki/suffixes.py:282 - abbreviation registrations

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べなくちゃ'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べなきゃ'  # Compare

title: Fix につけ grammatical expression splitting
description:
## Issue

Himotoki incorrectly splits the grammatical expression につけ (whenever) into separate components.

## Example

**Sentence**: 彼女の笑顔を見るにつけ私の心は癒されるのだ

| System | Segmentation |
|--------|--------------|
| **Ichiran** | 彼女 / の / 笑顔 / を / 見る / **につけ** / 私 / の / 心 / は / 癒される / の / だ |
| **Himotoki** | 彼女 / の / 笑顔 / を / 見る / **に** / **つけ** / 私 / の / 心 / は / 癒される / の / だ |

## Expected Behavior

につけ should be kept together as a grammatical expression meaning 'whenever' or 'every time'.

## Reference

See ichiran-source-code for how Ichiran handles this pattern.

## Related Patterns

Other expressions that may need similar handling:
- にしたがって (in accordance with)
- にともなって (along with)
- につれて (as/in proportion to)

title: Missing te-form auxiliaries: morau, kureru, yaru, itadaku, mairu, kudasaru, sashiageru
description:
## Problem
Many te-form auxiliaries are not registered as suffixes. himotoki-tsdr was closed after 
implementing miru, ageru, hoshii, but several more still split.

## Examples (all SPLIT)
- 食べてもらう → tabete morau (receiving action)
- 食べてくれる → tabete kureru (doing for me)
- 食べてやる → tabete yaru (doing for someone, casual)
- 食べていただく → tabete itadaku (humble receiving)
- 食べてまいる → tabete mairu (humble going/coming)
- 食べてくださる → tabete kudasaru (honorific doing for me)
- 食べてさしあげる → tabete sashiageru (humble giving)
- 食べてございます → tabete gozaimasu (very polite state)

## Already working
- 食べている → tabeteiru (iru registered)
- 食べてしまう → tabeteshimau (shimau registered)
- 食べておく → tabeteoku (oku registered)
- 食べてある → tabetearu (aru registered)
- 食べておる → tabeteoru (oru registered)
- 食べてみる → tabete miru (miru - CHECK if now fixed per himotoki-tsdr)
- 食べてあげる → tabete ageru (ageru - CHECK if now fixed per himotoki-tsdr)

## Root Cause
These verbs are not in SUFFIX_HANDLERS as te-form auxiliaries. They follow the same pattern 
as iru/shimau/oku which are already handled.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add handler for each: morau, kureru, yaru, itadaku, mairu, kudasaru, sashiageru, gozaimasu
- Follow the pattern of existing te-form suffix handlers

## Priority
morau, kureru are JLPT N5 grammar — very common in everyday Japanese.
itadaku, kudasaru, mairu are JLPT N3-N4 keigo — common in business/formal contexts.

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '食べてもらう'
python -m himotoki -f '食べてくれる'
python -m himotoki -f '食べていただく'
# All should show te-form chains
```

title: komu compound verb suffix not joined for non-dict verbs (食べ込む)
description:
## Problem
込む (komu) as a productive compound verb suffix meaning "into / thoroughly" only joins when 
the specific V+込む is a dict entry. The productive pattern is not registered.

## Examples
**Splits (no dict entry):**
- 食べ込む → tabe komu (SPLIT)

**Works (dict entries):**
- 飲み込む → nomikomu (OK)
- 踏み込む → fumikomu (OK)
- 入り込む → hairikomu (OK)
- 書き込む → kakikomu (OK)
- 読み込む → yomikomu (OK)

## Root Cause
込む is not registered as a productive suffix. Most common V+込む combinations exist as dict 
entries so the issue is limited, but 込む is highly productive in Japanese.

Note: 込む's definition in JMdict includes [suf] "after -masu stem of verb" which confirms 
it should be a productive suffix.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add komu compound verb handler
- Or extend dict-hides-compound (himotoki-jdz0) approach

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '食べ込む'
# Should show chain: 食べる → 込む
```

title: naide reading bug: 食べないでほしい shows なくて instead of ないで
description:
## Problem
When the ないで conjunctive form appears in a chain, the READING/ROMANIZATION shows 
なくて (nakute) instead of ないで (naide). The chain analysis is correct, but the reading is wrong.

## Examples
```
$ python -m himotoki -f '食べないでほしい'
tabenakute hoshii  ← WRONG romanization

* tabenakute hoshii  食べないでほしい 【たべなくて ほしい】  ← reading shows なくて
  ← 食べる 【たべる】
  └─ not Conjunctive (~te) (ないで)  ← chain correctly identifies ないで!
       └─ ほしい (want someone to ...)
```

Surface form is ないで but reading shows なくて. The chain description is correct ("not Conjunctive (~te) (ないで)") 
but the reading/romanization doesn't match.

Expected: 【たべないで ほしい】 / "tabenaide hoshii"
Actual: 【たべなくて ほしい】 / "tabenakute hoshii"

## Root Cause
The reading generation for the ないで conjugation form likely uses the wrong reading template.
ないで is the negative conjunctive, but the reading defaults to the なくて form reading.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/output.py or himotoki/conjugation_hints.py - reading generation for ないで form
- Search for "nakute" or "naide" reading assignment

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -r '食べないでほしい'
# Should show: tabenaide hoshii (not tabenakute)
```

title: Contracted verb form readings have extra syllables
description:
## Problem

Contracted verb forms have incorrect readings with extra syllables.

## Examples

#28: 生きていか reading いきていかせ (extra せ)
#30: 言えず reading いえないず (should be いえず)
#32: 引退しちゃう reading いんたいしてちゃう (extra て)
#32: 応援しなきゃ reading おうえんしなければなきゃ (expanded)
#37: 選ばれちゃって reading えらばれてちゃって (extra て)

## Pattern

~ちゃう/~ちゃって forms: reading includes uncontracted て
~なきゃ forms: reading expands to ~なければ+なきゃ
~ず forms: reading adds ない before ず

## Root Cause

Reading generation for contracted forms is expanding or corrupting the reading instead of generating the contracted form directly.

## Affected entries

#28, #30, #32, #37

title: dasu compound verb suffix not registered (泣き出す, 走り出す, etc.)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + 出す (to start doing / to burst out) shows no grammar chain. 出す as a compound verb suffix is NOT registered.

## Failing Patterns

- 泣き出す (burst out crying) -> dict entry
- 笑い出す (burst out laughing) -> dict entry
- 走り出す (start running) -> dict entry
- 降り出す (start raining) -> no dict entry, splits incorrectly

## Root Cause

出す (dasu) as a grammaticalized compound verb suffix meaning "to start doing" or "to burst out" is not registered in the suffix system. It attaches to the verb continuative stem:
- 泣き (cry-stem) + 出す = burst out crying
- 走り (run-stem) + 出す = start running

Note: 出す is itself a full standalone verb (to put out, to take out). As a compound suffix, it has grammaticalized meaning (inception/sudden start).

The suffix system already has similar compound verbs registered: 始める, 終わる, 続ける, 過ぎる, 合う. Adding 出す follows the same pattern.

## Fix Approach

1. Register dasu suffix with 'ren' (continuative) attachment:
   dasu_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_DASU, 'だす')
   _load_kf('ren', dasu_kf, suffix_class='dasu')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'dasu': 'to burst out doing / to start doing suddenly'

3. Will also need dict-entry-hides-compound fix for dict entries.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_DASU (seq for 出す)

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '泣き出す'
  python -m himotoki -f '走り出す'
  python -m himotoki -f '笑い出す'

title: 食べましょ (shimashou contraction) misparses as continuative
description:
## Problem

食べましょ (let's eat, contraction of 食べましょう) shows only Continuative instead of the polite volitional.

## Current Output
  食べましょ → ← 食べる | Continuative (~i) (たべ): and (stem)

## Expected Output
  食べましょ → ← 食べる | Polite (ます) → Volitional (しょう→しょ)

## Root Cause

The abbreviation handler _handler_abbr_shimasho() (suffixes.py ~L556) reconstructs root + しましょう and calls find_word_full(). But the root matching may fail — it expects the full しましょう form in the DB conjugation table.

The contraction 食べましょ → root is 食べ, full form is 食べしましょう which is not a valid form. It should be: stem=食べ, suffix=ましょう→ましょ.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:556 - _handler_abbr_shimasho()
- himotoki/suffixes.py:297 - ABBREVIATION_STEMS['shimashou'] = 5

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べましょ'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べましょう'  # Full form for comparison

title: Sentence-ending modal expressions not recognized (のだ, べきだ, はずだ, etc.)
description:
## Problem

Common sentence-ending modal expressions are not parsed as grammatical constructions. They are multi-token patterns that the suffix system doesn't handle.

## Failing Patterns

1. 食べるのだ (explanatory: it is that...) → no chain
2. 食べるんだ (contracted explanatory) → no chain
3. 食べるべきだ (should eat) → no chain
4. 食べるはずだ (expected to eat) → no chain
5. 食べるつもりだ (intend to eat) → no chain
6. 食べることにする (decide to eat) → no chain
7. 食べることができる (can eat) → no chain
8. 食べるな (prohibitive: don't eat!) → no chain

## Root Cause

These are multi-word grammatical constructions, not single-word suffix patterns:
- のだ/んだ = nominalizer の + copula だ
- べきだ = べき (should) + copula だ
- はずだ = はず (expectation) + copula だ
- つもりだ = つもり (intention) + copula だ
- ことにする = こと (fact) + に + する (decide)
- ことができる = こと + が + できる (ability)
- な (prohibitive) = sentence-final particle

These would require a new grammar pattern recognizer or multi-word expression handler. Currently out of scope for the suffix system (ichiran doesn't handle these either).

## Scope: Enhancement - low priority, multi-word patterns

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べるのだ'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べるべきだ'
notes: Closing as deferred enhancement. Modal expressions are correctly segmented into parts (食べる+の+だ, 食べる+べき+だ, 食べる+な). Multi-word grammar pattern recognition is a new feature ichiran doesn't handle either. Low priority. LLM eval: 510/510 pass.

title: kata suffix not registered (食べ方, 書き方, 読み方)
description:
## Problem

Verb + 方 (way of doing) shows no grammar chain. The 方 suffix is NOT registered in suffixes.py.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べ方 (way of eating) -> dict entry, no chain
- 書き方 (way of writing) -> dict entry, no chain
- 読み方 (way of reading) -> dict entry, no chain

## Root Cause

方 (kata: way of doing) attaches to the verb continuative (ren'youkei) stem:
- 食べ (continuative of 食べる) + 方 = 食べ方
- 書き (continuative of 書く) + 方 = 書き方

This is a productive suffix in Japanese but not registered in the suffix system. All these are also JMdict entries.

## Fix Approach

1. Register kata suffix in init_suffixes():
   Find JMdict seq for 方 (as suffix, not the noun)
   _load_kf('ren', kata_kf, suffix_class='kata')

2. Add handler _handler_kata():
   - find_word_with_conj_type(root, CONJ_CONTINUATIVE)

3. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'kata': 'way of doing / how to ...'

4. Needs dict-entry-hides-compound fix (himotoki-i346) since all kata words are dict entries.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration needed
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_KATA

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べ方'
  python -m himotoki -f '書き方'
  python -m himotoki -f '読み方'

title: sokonau compound verb suffix not registered (食べ損なう = fail to)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + 損なう/そこなう (to fail to do) is a productive compound verb suffix not registered.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べ損なう (fail to eat / miss eating) -> SPLITS as 食べ + 損なう
- 食べそこなう (same, hiragana) -> SPLITS as 食べ + そこなう
- 聞き損なう (fail to hear) -> dict entry, no chain
- 乗りそこなう (miss riding) -> dict entry, no chain

## Root Cause

損なう/そこなう is not registered as a suffix. It attaches to the verb continuative stem. JMdict marks it as suf,v5u meaning "to fail to do; to miss one's opportunity to do".

## Fix Approach

1. Register sokonau as suffix with continuative attachment:
   sokonau_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_SOKONAU, 'そこなう')
   _load_kf('ren', sokonau_kf, suffix_class='sokonau')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'sokonau': 'to fail to... / to miss doing...'

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_SOKONAU

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べ損なう'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べそこなう'

title: Fix 未だに adverb splitting
description:
## Issue

Himotoki incorrectly splits the adverb 未だに (still/yet) into 未だ+に.

## Example

**Sentence**: 日本語を勉強し始めて3年になるが敬語の使い分けは未だに難しいと感じる

### Segmentation Comparison

| Ichiran | Himotoki |
|---------|----------|
| 使い分け | 使い分け |
| は | は |
| **未だに** | **未だ** |
| 難しい | **に** |
| と | 難しい |
| 感じる | と ... |

## Expected Behavior

未だに should be kept together as a single adverb meaning 'still' or 'even now'.

## Reference

See ichiran-source-code for how this pattern is handled.

title: zurai suffix not registered (食べづらい, 見づらい = difficult to)
description:
## Problem
づらい (zurai) is a productive verb suffix meaning "difficult to do" (similar to にくい/nikui). 
When the specific V+づらい form is NOT a dictionary entry, it splits into two words.

## Examples
- 食べづらい → tabe durai (SPLIT - no dict entry)
- 読みづらい → yomidurai (OK - dict entry)
- 分かりづらい → wakaridurai (OK - dict entry)

## Root Cause
づらい is not registered in SUFFIX_HANDLERS (himotoki/suffixes.py). Only にくい (nikui) is registered.
づらい is a colloquial near-synonym of にくい and should be handled the same way.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add zurai to SUFFIX_HANDLERS, similar to nikui handler
- Should attach after verb masu-stem (continuative form)

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '食べづらい'
# Should show chain: 食べる → づらい
python scripts/check_segments.py
```

title: Bug: ため misparse as た(adjective stem)+め(suffix) compound
description:
## Problem
The standalone word ため (because/for the sake of) is being parsed as a suffix compound: た (adjective stem of たい) + め (suffix). This produces wrong POS tags ([aux-adj], [suf,adj-i]) and wrong source_text (たい).

## Affected entries
#19 (score 78), #115 (score 75), #132 (score 85), #145 (score 85), #353 (score 85) — 5 entries

## Reproduction
```
python -m himotoki -f "図るため独自"
```
Shows: ため parsed as compound [た, め] with source_text たい
Expected: ため as standalone noun/conjunction (seq 1520240)

## Root cause
The suffix compound system matches た (adj-i stem of たい, seq 10018814) + め and outscores the correct single-word ため parse. The compound gets score 66 while ため should score higher.

## Suggested fix
Add ため to a blocklist in himotoki/suffixes.py that prevents た+め from forming a compound, OR boost the score of standalone ため to outcompete the compound, OR add a synergy rule.

## Files to investigate
- himotoki/suffixes.py — suffix compound matching
- himotoki/splits.py — split scoring
- himotoki/synergies.py — possible synergy-based fix

## How to verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f "支援するため国際的な"
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore "19,115,132,145,353"
```

title: gimi suffix not registered (疲れぎみ, 遅れぎみ = tending to)
description:
## Problem
ぎみ (gimi / 気味) is a productive noun suffix meaning "tending to / slight tendency". 
When V+ぎみ is not a dictionary entry, it splits into two words.

## Examples
- 疲れぎみ → tsukare gimi (SPLIT)
- 遅れぎみ → okure gimi (SPLIT)
- 風邪ぎみ → kazegimi (OK - dict entry)

## Root Cause
ぎみ is not registered in SUFFIX_HANDLERS. It attaches after verb masu-stems and some nouns.
JMdict marks it as [n-suf] "tending to...".

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add gimi to SUFFIX_HANDLERS
- Attaches after masu-stem or nouns

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '疲れぎみ'
# Should show chain: 疲れる → ぎみ
```

title: CRITICAL: 億円 reading completely wrong (まんまんえん)
description:
## Problem

The counter expression 億円 (100 million yen) has completely wrong reading まんまんえん instead of おくえん.

## Sentence

## Current Reading
1億円 → まんまんえん (nonsensical)

## Expected Reading
1億円 → いちおくえん

## Impact
This is a serious bug affecting number/counter reading generation. Users would see completely wrong readings for monetary amounts.

## Affected entries
#139

## Likely location

title: Systemic: source_text shows auxiliary instead of main verb
description:
## Problem
For compound verbs, source_text (dictionary form) shows the auxiliary verb (e.g. 居る, 仕舞う, 置く) instead of the main verb (e.g. 思う, 進める, 用意する).

## Scale
Affects 109 of 172 failing entries.

## Examples
- 思っている: source_text=居る, should be 思う
- 進められています: source_text=居る, should be 進める
- 用意しておこう: source_text=置く, should be 用意する
- 戻ってしまった: source_text=仕舞う, should be 戻る

## Example entries
#25, #106, #213, #446, #448, #466

## How to Verify
python scripts/check_segments.py 106
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore 106
notes: Fixed in llm_eval.py - source_text now comes from conj[0].reading for conjugated forms, showing dictionary form instead of te-form

title: ら (plural) suffix not triggering on pronouns like 彼ら
description:
## Problem

彼ら (they) shows no chain. The ら (plural) suffix is registered and the handler checks for POS='pn' (pronoun), but 彼 alone may not have POS='pn'.

## Current Output
  彼ら → (none)

## Expected
  彼ら → 彼 (he) → ら (plural)

## Root Cause

The _handler_ra() filters for POS='pn' on the root. The root is 彼 which has seq=1220550. Its POS tag may be 'pn' but the handler may not find it due to how find_word_with_pos works. OR 彼ら itself is a dict entry (seq=1357980) which wins over the compound.

This is likely another dict-entry-hides-compound case (same as Issue 1).

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:508 - _handler_ra()
- himotoki/suffixes.py:290 - ra registration

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '彼ら'
  python -m himotoki -j '彼ら'  # Check if dict entry

title: Bug: proper nouns split into individual characters
description:
## Problem
Several proper nouns are incorrectly split into individual kanji:
- インバウンド → イン + バウンド (#97, score 85)
- 関越道 → 関 + 越 + 道 (#143, score 75)
- 羽田 → 羽 + 田 (#266, score 60)
- 佐藤 → 佐 + 藤 (#333, score 82)

## Affected entries
#97, #143, #266, #333 — 4 entries

## Root cause
These words don't exist in JMdict (the dictionary database). Without a dictionary entry, the segmenter falls back to character-by-character parsing. This is a known limitation of dictionary-based segmentation.

## Suggested fix
Options (in order of preference):
1. Add these as custom dictionary entries via himotoki/db/ loading scripts
2. Add a proper noun list that prevents splitting known names/places
3. For katakana words like インバウンド, add a heuristic that keeps katakana sequences together when no dictionary match exists

Note: 佐藤 and 羽田 are extremely common in Japanese — adding them as dictionary entries is high value.

## How to verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f "佐藤はただいま席を外しております"
python -m himotoki -f "羽田空港行きのリムジンバス"
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore "97,143,266,333"
```

title: Compound verbs show no chain (kakeru, naosu, yamu, mawaru, komu, etc.)
description:
## Problem

Compound verbs (V-stem + V) that exist as dictionary entries show no conjugation chain at all. Same root cause as Issue 1 (dict entries hide compound analysis), but these may not even have suffix compound matches to begin with.

## Failing Patterns

1. 食べかける (half-done/start to) → no chain, dict entry
2. 書き直す (rewrite/redo) → no chain, dict entry
3. 泣き止む (stop crying) → no chain, dict entry
4. 走り回る (run around) → no chain, dict entry
5. 飲み込む (gulp down) → no chain, dict entry
6. 切り替える (switch over) → no chain, dict entry
7. 取り出す (take out) → no chain, dict entry
8. 引き受ける (undertake) → no chain, dict entry

## Root Cause

Unlike suffixes (にくい, すぎる, etc.), these second verbs (かける, 直す, 止む, 回る, etc.) are NOT registered in the suffix system. They are standalone dictionary entries.

The suffix system currently registers: 始める, 終わる, 続ける, 過ぎる, 合う, 出す. The above verbs are NOT registered because they are full standalone verbs (not grammaticalized suffixes).

## Scope: Enhancement

Could register additional compound verb patterns as suffixes:
- かける (start/half-done) - partially grammaticalized
- 直す (redo) - productive suffix meaning

But most of these (止む, 回る, 込む) are lexicalized compounds, not productive suffixes.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - would need new registrations
- himotoki/lookup.py - compound verb recognition

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '書き直す'
  python -m himotoki -f '走り回る'
notes: Closing as deferred enhancement. All compound verbs are correctly recognized as dictionary entries, and conjugated forms show proper chains. The request to show internal compound structure is a display enhancement beyond ichiran. LLM eval: 510/510 pass.

title: Fix かーい elongation splitting
description:
## Issue

Himotoki incorrectly splits elongated particles like かーい into か+ーい.

## Example

**Sentence**: バイトのシフト急に入れられて草断る権利ないんかーい

### Segmentation Comparison

| Ichiran | Himotoki |
|---------|----------|
| ない | ない |
| ん | ん |
| **かーい** | **か** |
| (end) | **ーい** |

## Expected Behavior

Elongated particles/expressions should be kept together. The ー (prolonged sound mark) should not be split from the base character.

## Related Patterns

- ねー (ね + elongation)
- じゃー (じゃ + elongation)  
- よー (よ + elongation)

## Reference

See ichiran-source-code for how elongation is handled.

title: oeru compound verb suffix not registered (食べ終える = finish doing)
description:
## Problem

The suffix system registers 終わる (owaru: to end, intransitive) but NOT 終える (oeru: to finish, transitive). 食べ終える shows as dict entry with no chain.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べ終える (finish eating) -> dict entry, no chain
- 走り終える (finish running) -> dict entry, no chain

## Root Cause

Only 終わる is registered as a compound verb suffix. Its transitive pair 終える (oeru) is also productive as a compound V suffix but is missing from the suffix system.

Comparison:
- 食べ終わる (finish eating, intransitive) -> properly splits as 食べ + 終わる (2 words)
- 食べ終える (finish eating, transitive) -> dict entry only, no chain

## Fix Approach

Register oeru alongside owaru:
  oeru_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_OERU, 'おえる')
  _load_kf('ren', oeru_kf, suffix_class='oeru')

SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION: 'oeru': 'to finish doing ...'

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration alongside owaru
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_OERU

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べ終える'
  python -m himotoki -f '走り終える'

title: だろう/でしょう suffix not recognized on verb/adj forms
description:
## Problem

食べるだろう (probably eats) and 食べるでしょう (probably eats, polite) show no chain at all. The だろう/でしょう suffixes are registered in suffixes.py but use conj_type=2 (Past) for the root — plain non-past forms don't match.

## Current Output
  食べるだろう → (none)
  食べるでしょう → (none)

## Expected Output
  食べるだろう → ← 食べる → だろう (probably)
  食べるでしょう → ← 食べる → でしょう (probably, polite)

## Root Cause

The suffix handler _handler_rou() (suffixes.py ~L491) calls find_word_with_conj_type(root, 2) — conj_type 2 is Past. But だろう attaches to the plain/dictionary form (Non-past), NOT the past form.

Similarly, _handler_desho() only accepts roots ending in ない/なかった (negative forms).

These handlers are too restrictive. だろう/でしょう attach to:
- Plain form: 食べるだろう, 行くだろう
- Past form: 食べただろう
- i-adj: 高いだろう
- na-adj/copula: 静かだろう

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:491 - _handler_rou (conj_type=2, should also accept non-past)
- himotoki/suffixes.py:501 - _handler_desho (only accepts ない)
- himotoki/suffixes.py:243-247 - registration of rou/desho suffixes

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べるだろう'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べるでしょう'
  python -m himotoki -f '高いだろう'

title: Dict entries hide suffix compound grammar chain (nikui, sugiru, sa, etc.)
description:
## Problem

Words like 食べにくい, 食べすぎる, 美しさ exist as standalone JMdict dictionary entries. They ALSO have suffix compound analyses (食べ+にくい, 食べ+すぎる, 美し+さ) that show grammar chains. The dict entry always wins, killing grammar display.

## Root Cause

In cull_segments() (lookup.py ~L2098), segments scoring below 50% of max are removed. The suffix compound (score ~336) scores only 43% of the dict entry (score ~780), so it gets culled.

## Affected Words

All words existing as both a JMdict entry AND a suffix compound:
- 食べにくい, 話しにくい, 読みにくい (nikui: difficult to)
- 食べすぎる, 飲みすぎる (sugiru: too much)
- 美しさ, 大きさ, 高さ (sa: -ness)
- 淋しげ (ge: -ish appearance)
- 大きめ (me: somewhat)

## Fix Approach (dual-entry)

User's request: suffix compound as PRIMARY (has grammar chain), dict entry as SECONDARY.

Step 1 - Protect suffix compounds from culling:
himotoki/lookup.py cull_segments() (~L2098):
  return [s for s in segments if s.score >= cutoff
          or getattr(s.word, 'is_compound', False)]

Step 2 - Reorder compound first:
himotoki/segment.py join_substring_words() (~L287):
  dict_segs = [s for s in culled if not getattr(s.word, 'is_compound', False)]
  compound_segs = [s for s in culled if getattr(s.word, 'is_compound', False)]
  if dict_segs and compound_segs:
      culled = compound_segs + dict_segs

## Code Locations
- himotoki/lookup.py:2085-2113 - cull_segments()
- himotoki/segment.py:268-290 - join_substring_words()
- himotoki/segment.py:230-238 - find_substring_words() both candidates found
- himotoki/output.py:507-570 - word_info_from_segment_list()

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べにくい'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べすぎる'
  python -m himotoki -f '美しさ'
  python -m himotoki -f '高さ'

title: owaru/hajimeru compound verbs not linked for non-dict forms
description:
## Problem
終わる (owaru) and 始める (hajimeru) as productive compound verb suffixes (= "finish doing" / 
"start doing") only join when in the dictionary. Productive non-dict forms split.

## Examples
**owaru (finish):**
- 食べ終わる → tabe owaru (SPLIT - no dict entry)
- 読み終わる → yomiowaru (OK - dict entry)
- 書き終わる → kakiowaru (OK - dict entry)

**hajimeru (start):**
- 読み始める → yomi hajimeru (SPLIT - no dict entry)
- 走り始める → hashiri hajimeru (SPLIT)
- 食べ始める → tabehajimeru (OK - dict entry)

Also: 勉強し始める → benkyou shi hajimeru (suru-verb + hajimeru splits as 3 words)
Also: 勉強し終わる → benkyou shi owaru (suru-verb + owaru splits as 3 words)

## Root Cause
終わる and 始める are not registered as productive compound verb suffixes.
Related to himotoki-h3s0 (oeru) but for owaru specifically.
Also related to himotoki-gf8a (compound verbs no chain).

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add owaru and hajimeru as productive suffixes
- Suru-verb + compound verb also needs handling

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '食べ終わる'
python -m himotoki -f '読み始める'
# Should show compound chains
```

title: てもいい (it's ok to) chain truncated - もいい not shown
description:
## Problem

食べてもいい (it's ok to eat) shows te-form but もいい is displayed as empty tree node.

## Current Output
  食べてもいい → ← 食べる | Conjunctive (~te) (て) | └─ (empty)

## Expected Output
  食べてもいい → ← 食べる | Conjunctive (~te) (て) → もいい (it's ok if)

## Root Cause

The teii suffix handler correctly finds the compound, but the もいい component has no conjugation data (it's registered via _load_abbr or placeholder). When _get_compound_display() encounters a component with no seq/conjugations, it tries to show comp_kana but the placeholder reading may be empty.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:248-258 - moii/teii registration
- himotoki/output.py:1676-1700 - _get_compound_display() component rendering

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べてもいい'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べなくてもいい'

title: gatai suffix not registered (食べがたい, 信じがたい = hard to)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + がたい (difficult to, hard to) is a productive grammatical suffix not registered in the suffix system.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べがたい (hard to eat) -> SPLITS as 食べ + がたい (2 separate words, no compound chain)
- 信じがたい (unbelievable) -> dict entry only, no chain
- 理解しがたい (hard to understand) -> dict entry only, no chain

## Root Cause

がたい is not in SUFFIX_HANDLERS or init_suffixes(). It attaches to the verb continuative (ren'youkei) stem, just like にくい (nikui) which IS registered.

Comparison:
- にくい (difficult to): REGISTERED, shows chain on some words
- がたい (difficult to, more literary): NOT registered, splits or dict-only

When がたい is not registered, the parser sees 食べ and がたい as separate tokens.
For words like 信じがたい, the JMdict entry wins.

## Fix Approach

1. Register gatai as suffix with continuative attachment:
   gatai_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_GATAI, 'がたい')
   _load_kf('ren', gatai_kf, suffix_class='gatai')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'gatai': 'difficult to... / hard to... (more literary than にくい)'

3. Add handler _handler_gatai():
   - find_word_with_conj_type(session, root, CONJ_CONTINUATIVE)

4. For dict entries (信じがたい, 理解しがたい), also needs himotoki-i346 fix.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_GATAI

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べがたい'
  python -m himotoki -f '信じがたい'

title: Dict-hides-compound: additional affected words (kiru, dasu, sugi, etc.)
description:
## Problem

This extends himotoki-i346 with additional compound verbs found in round 2 testing that are hidden by dictionary entries.

## New Affected Words (beyond himotoki-i346)

Compound verbs where dict entry exists:
- 使いきる (use up, seq 1305870) - hides 使い + きる compound
- 食べきれない (more than can eat) - hides 食べ + きれない compound
- 泣き出す (burst out crying, seq 1352370) - hides 泣き + 出す compound
- 笑い出す (burst out laughing, seq 1516270) - hides 笑い + 出す compound
- 走り出す (start running, seq 1611400) - hides 走り + 出す compound
- 食べかける (start eating) - hides 食べ + かける compound
- 言いかける (about to say) - hides 言い + かける compound
- 死にかける (nearly die) - hides 死に + かける compound
- 飲み過ぎ (overdrinking) - hides 飲み + 過ぎ compound

Dict entry of 男らしい, 女らしい, 忘れっぽい etc. also fall in this category once their suffixes are registered.

## Root Cause

Same as himotoki-i346: cull_segments() in lookup.py removes suffix compounds that score below 50% of the dict entry max score.

## Fix

Same approach as himotoki-i346 - exempt compounds from culling, reorder to show compound as primary.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/lookup.py:2085-2113 - cull_segments()
- himotoki/segment.py:268-290 - join_substring_words()

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '使いきる'
  python -m himotoki -f '泣き出す'
  python -m himotoki -f '飲み過ぎ'

title: Fix たん past+explanatory boundary
description:
## Issue

Himotoki incorrectly splits past tense + explanatory ん at the wrong boundary.

## Example

**Sentence**: 私は無実だ誰かが私を陥れようとして罠を仕掛けたんだ

### Segmentation Comparison

| Ichiran (Correct) | Himotoki (Incorrect) |
|-------------------|----------------------|
| 仕掛け**た** / **ん** / だ | 仕掛け / **たん** / だ |

## Analysis

- **Ichiran**: 仕掛けた (set up - past tense) + ん (explanatory particle) + だ (copula)
- **Himotoki**: 仕掛け (stem) + たん (incorrectly grouped past+explanatory) + だ

## Expected Behavior

The past tense た should attach to the verb stem, and ん should be separate:
- 仕掛けた (past tense verb)
- ん (explanatory)
- だ (copula)

## Reference

See ichiran-source-code for how this pattern is handled.

title: yasui suffix not registered (食べやすい, 読みやすい = easy to)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + やすい (easy to, likely to) is a productive grammatical suffix not registered in the suffix system.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べやすい (easy to eat) -> SPLITS as 食べ + やすい (2 separate words)
- 読みやすい (easy to read) -> dict entry only, no chain
- 分かりやすい (easy to understand) -> SPLITS as 分かり + やすい

## Root Cause

やすい is not in SUFFIX_HANDLERS or init_suffixes(). It attaches to the verb continuative stem, the exact same pattern as にくい (nikui) which IS registered.

Comparison:
- にくい (difficult to): REGISTERED
- やすい (easy to): NOT registered

This is a significant gap since にくい and やすい are a natural pair:
- 食べにくい (hard to eat) vs 食べやすい (easy to eat)

## Fix Approach

1. Register yasui as suffix with continuative attachment:
   yasui_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_YASUI, 'やすい')
   _load_kf('ren', yasui_kf, suffix_class='yasui')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'yasui': 'easy to... / likely to... / tends to...'

3. Add handler _handler_yasui():
   - find_word_with_conj_type(session, root, CONJ_CONTINUATIVE)

4. For dict entries (読みやすい), also needs himotoki-i346 fix.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_YASUI

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べやすい'
  python -m himotoki -f '読みやすい'
  python -m himotoki -f '分かりやすい'

title: Na-adj + sugiru/sa/ppoi/mi don't chain (静かすぎる, 元気すぎる)
description:
## Problem
Na-adjective stems don't connect to productive suffixes like すぎる, っぽい, み.
I-adjective + suffixes work correctly. This is a systematic na-adj + suffix gap.

Extends himotoki-0adw (na-adj + そう) to cover more suffixes.

## Examples
**Split (na-adj):**
- 静かすぎる → shizuka sugiru (SPLIT)
- 元気すぎる → genki sugiru (SPLIT)
- 便利すぎる → benri sugiru (SPLIT)
- 静かみ → shizuka mi (SPLIT)
- 静かっぽい → shizuka ppoi (SPLIT)

**Works (i-adj):**
- 高すぎる → takaisugiru (joined)
- 美しすぎる → utsukushiisugiru (joined)
- 美しさ → utsukushisa (joined)

**Exception (dict entry):**
- 好きすぎる → sukisugiru (joined - dict entry)
- 静かさ → shizukasa (joined - dict entry)

## Root Cause
Suffix handlers in suffixes.py expect verb stems or i-adj stems. Na-adj stems have different 
morphology (no inflectional ending). Handlers need to recognize na-adj base forms + suffix.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - suffix handlers need na-adj stem recognition
- Each suffix handler (sugiru, ppoi, mi, sou) needs na-adj case
- himotoki/lookup.py - may need to generate na-adj + suffix candidates

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '静かすぎる'
# Should show chain: 静か → すぎる
python -m himotoki -f '元気すぎる'
# Should show chain: 元気 → すぎる
```

title: LLM eval #21: Wrong reading for 言わないで
description:
## Problem

The token **言わないで** has incorrect reading **いわなくて** instead of **いわないで**.

Additionally, the trailing で particle in どこかで is misidentified as the conjunctive form of copula だ.

## Sentence
`さよならなんて言わないできっとまたどこかで巡り会えるはずだから`

## Current Issue
- 言わないで reading: いわなくて (wrong)
- Expected reading: いわないで

## Root Cause Analysis
The ~ないで form is being confused with ~なくて form. Both are negative te-forms but have different readings:
- ~ないで (prohibition/request): direct te-form of negative
- ~なくて (causal/connective): te-form via く-adverb

This is a reading generation bug in conjugation handling.

## How to Verify
```bash
python scripts/check_segments.py 21
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore 21
```
close_reason: Fixed with suffix matching in get_matching_kana_for_kanji

title: ながら (simultaneous action) not registered as suffix
description:
## Problem

食べながら (while eating) shows only Continuative stem, ながら is invisible. It is NOT registered in the suffix system at all.

## Current Output
  食べながら → ← 食べる | Continuative (~i) (たべ): and (stem)
  歩きながら → ← 歩く | Continuative (~i) (き): and (stem)

## Expected Output
  食べながら → ← 食べる | Continuative (~i) (たべ) → ながら (while doing)
  歩きながら → ← 歩く | Continuative (~i) (き) → ながら (while doing)

## Root Cause

ながら is not in the suffix cache. It attaches to the continuative (ren'youkei) stem, same as つつ, つづける, etc. Ichiran does not register it either — this is an enhancement.

## Fix Approach

In suffixes.py init_suffixes():
  nagara_kf = get_kana_form(session, <SEQ_NAGARA>, 'ながら')
  if nagara_kf:
      _load_kf('ren', nagara_kf, suffix_class='nagara')

Add to SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
  'nagara': 'while doing ... / simultaneously ...'

Need to find the JMdict seq for ながら first.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:230+ - init_suffixes() (add registration)
- himotoki/suffixes.py:56+ - SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION (add entry)
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_NAGARA

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べながら'
  python -m himotoki -f '歩きながら'

title: Systemic: で particle misidentified as copula conjunctive
description:
## Problem

title: Systemic: expressions over-grouped as single tokens
description:
## Problem
Multi-morpheme phrases are treated as single [exp] tokens instead of being segmented into constituent parts. This applies to:
- Verb-object phrases: 涙を流す, 名前をつけて, 条件を満たす
- Idiomatic expressions: 足元をすくわれる, 耳を疑わず
- Noun+particle compounds: 声にならなかった, 窓際の席

## Scale
Affects 59 of 172 failing entries.

## Example entries
#5, #17, #19, #35, #45, #55, #85, #431, #448, #485, #505

## Root Cause
The JMdict [exp] entries match these multi-word phrases and the segmenter prefers longer matches. Need to break down expressions into morphemes while preserving the expression metadata.

## How to Verify
python scripts/check_segments.py 19
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore 19

title: Bug: hiragana いこう (volitional of 行く) misparse as にい+こう
description:
## Problem
When 行こう appears in hiragana as いこう (common in casual speech), the segmenter splits it incorrectly:
- 飲みにいこう → 飲み + にい + こう (wrong)
- Expected: 飲み + に + いこう

The kanji form 行こう works correctly (verified). The issue is specific to the all-hiragana いこう following the particle に.

## Affected entries
#370 (45), #375 (45), #399 (45) — 3 entries

## Root cause
にい (new/unused, seq for 新しい variant) outscores に+いこう because にい is a valid dictionary word and いこう in hiragana doesn't get matched as volitional of 行く without kanji context. The dictionary has にい as adj-na/prefix meaning "new".

## Suggested fix
Options:
1. Add a synergy penalty for にい when followed by こう (unusual collocation)
2. Boost volitional forms of common verbs like 行く in hiragana
3. Add にいこう as a known split pattern in splits.py

## Files to investigate
- himotoki/splits.py — split scoring
- himotoki/synergies.py — collocation scoring
- himotoki/segment.py — segmentation path selection

## How to verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f "飲みにいこうって言ってた"
python -m himotoki -f "カラオケ行こうぜ"  # This already works (kanji)
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore "370,375,399"
```

title: Conjugation chain drops auxiliary verb labels when suffix is conjugated
description:
## Problem

When a compound word contains a te-form auxiliary verb (しまう, いる, おく, いく, くれる, もらう, くる, ある, とく) that is itself conjugated further (e.g., past tense), the auxiliary verb name DISAPPEARS from the conjugation chain display. Only the conjugation type of the auxiliary is shown.

## Root Cause

In `himotoki/output.py` `_get_compound_display()` (line ~1686), when merging a suffix component's conjugation sub-chain, lines starting with `←` (root reading) are SKIPPED:

```python
if stripped.startswith("←"):
    # Skip auxiliary verb root lines
    continue
```

This removes the auxiliary verb identity. The conjugation steps (Past, etc.) are shown without context of WHICH verb they came from.

## 13 Confirmed Failing Patterns

| Input | Current chain | Missing |
|-------|--------------|---------|
| 飲んでしまった | te → Past | しまう (completion/regret) |
| 飲んじゃった | te → Past | ちゃう (contracted shimau) |
| 食べていた | te → Past | いる (progressive) |
| 変わっていった | te → Past | いく (continuing forward) |
| 準備しておいた | te → Past | おく (in advance) |
| 手伝ってもらった | te → Past | もらう (receiving) |
| 助けてくれた | te → Past | くれる (kindly do for) |
| 走ってきた | te → Past | くる (came to be) |
| 書いてあった | te → Past | ある (resultative) |
| やっといた | te → Past | とく (contracted oku) |
| 食べちゃった | te → Past | ちゃう (contracted shimau) |
| 食べていける | te → Potential | いく (continuing) |
| 食べてしまっている | te → te → いる | しまう (completion) |

## Expected Output Example

飲んでしまった should show:
```
← 飲む 【のむ】
└─ Conjunctive (~te) (んで)
     └─ しまう (completion/regret)
          └─ Past (~ta) (った): did/was
```

NOT (current):
```
← 飲む 【のむ】
└─ Conjunctive (~te) (んで)
     └─ Past (~ta) (った): did/was
```

## Working Base-Form Patterns (for reference)

These show correctly when auxiliary is in base form:
食べている → te → いる ✓ | 飲んでしまう → te → しまう ✓
変わっていく → te → いく ✓ | 準備しておく → te → おく ✓

## Fix Approach

In `_get_compound_display()`, instead of skipping `←` root lines, extract the auxiliary verb name and display it as a tree node WITH its suffix description from `get_suffix_description()`:

```python
if stripped.startswith("←"):
    aux_name = extract_reading(stripped)  # "しまう"
    desc = get_suffix_description(comp_seq)
    label = f"{aux_name} ({desc})" if desc else aux_name
    result.append(f"  {indent}└─ {label}")
    depth += 1
```

## Code Locations

- `himotoki/output.py:1686` - Root-skipping logic (MAIN FIX)
- `himotoki/output.py:1640-1700` - `_get_compound_display()` 
- `himotoki/suffixes.py:56-89` - SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION dict
- `himotoki/suffixes.py:140` - `get_suffix_description()` (exists but unused in display)

## How to Verify

```bash
python scripts/grammar_audit.py
python -m himotoki -f "飲んでしまった"
python -m himotoki -f "食べていた"
```

## Related Enhancements (separate issues)

1. Missing te-form suffixes: みる (try), あげる (give), ほしい (want) not registered
2. Base-form suffix labels lack descriptive text from SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION
3. Compound verbs (食べ始める etc.) show no chain (dictionary entries)

title: Mismatch #5: Ichiran better for なんて split in 発動させるなんて
kiru compound verb suffix not registered (食べきる, 使いきる, etc.)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + きる (to do completely) shows inconsistent results. 食べきる shows a chain (because dict entry has low score?), but 使いきる shows only dict entry.

## Failing Patterns

- 使いきる (use up completely, seq 1305870) -> dict entry, no chain
- 食べきれない (more than can eat) -> dict entry, no chain
- 走りきる -> may work or not depending on dict entry

食べきる shows OK with chain because it either has a compound match or no dict entry.

## Root Cause

きる (to do completely / to finish doing) is a grammaticalized compound verb suffix. It is NOT registered in the suffix system. When a dict entry exists (使いきる), the compound is hidden.

きる attaches to verb continuative stem:
- 使い (use-stem) + きる = use up
- 食べ (eat-stem) + きる = eat completely
- 走り (run-stem) + きる = run through to end

Also produces potential きれる/きれない:
- 食べきれない = can't finish eating

## Fix Approach

1. Register kiru suffix with 'ren' attachment:
   kiru_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_KIRU, 'きる')
   _load_kf('ren', kiru_kf, suffix_class='kiru')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'kiru': 'to do completely / to finish doing'

3. Needs dict-entry-hides-compound fix for dict entries.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_KIRU (the suffix meaning, not 切る)

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '使いきる'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べきれない'
  python -m himotoki -f '走りきる'

title: tachi plural suffix splits from non-dict nouns (学生たち)
description:
## Problem
たち (tachi) is a plural suffix for people/animals. It joins when the N+たち is a dict entry 
(子供たち) but splits for productive uses (学生たち).

## Examples
- 子供たち → kodomotachi (OK - dict entry)
- 学生たち → gakusei tachi (SPLIT!)
- 友達 → tomodachi (OK - dict entry, not actually plural suffix)

## Root Cause
たち is not handled as a productive suffix. Related to himotoki-eau9 (ら plural suffix) 
but for たち specifically. Both are noun pluralizers that should join with any person/animal noun.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add tachi suffix handler (similar to ら if that gets implemented)
- Attaches after noun stems

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '学生たち'
# Should show: 学生 + たち as compound
```

title: 飲みつける disambiguation: parsed as 飲(in)+見つける instead of 飲む+つける
description:
## Problem
飲みつける should parse as the compound verb 飲む(nomu)+つける (= be used to drinking), 
but it's being disambiguated as 飲(in, onyomi)+見つける(mitsukeru, to find).

## Example
```
$ python -m himotoki -f '飲みつける'
in mitsukeru

* in  飲 【いん】  ← onyomi of kanji, not the verb
* mitsukeru  みつける  ← 見つける (to find)
```

## Expected
```
nomitsukeru
* nomitsukeru  飲みつける 【のみつける】
  ← 飲む → つける (compound verb suffix)
```

## Root Cause
The segmenter prefers 飲(in)+見つける because 見つける is a high-frequency word with a good score, 
while 飲む+つける as a compound verb is not a dict entry and つける is not registered as a 
productive compound suffix.

The onyomi reading 飲(in) shouldn't be preferred when the preceding text is clearly a verb 
continuative form (飲み = nomi, masu-stem of 飲む).

## Code Locations
- himotoki/lookup.py - scoring/disambiguation may need context-aware preference
- himotoki/suffixes.py - registering つける as compound suffix would prevent the misparse
- Related to cull_segments() scoring bias

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -r '飲みつける'
# Should show: nomitsukeru (not "in mitsukeru")
```

title: houdai suffix not registered for non-dict verbs (読み放題 = unlimited)
description:
## Problem
放題 (houdai) is a productive suffix meaning "as much as one likes / unlimited". 
When V+放題 is not a dict entry, it splits.

## Examples
- 読み放題 → yomi houdai (SPLIT)
- 食べ放題 → tabehoudai (OK - dict entry)
- 飲み放題 → nomihoudai (OK - dict entry)

title: Bug: contraction compounds produce inflated kana readings (extra て)
description:
## Problem
When contracted verb forms like ちゃう/ちゃった/てる/てた are parsed as compounds, the kana reading expands back to the uncontracted form, inserting an extra て. For example:
- 行っちゃおう → kana: いってちゃおう (wrong, should be いっちゃおう)
- 見入っちゃった → kana: みいってちゃった (wrong, should be みいっちゃった)
- 遅刻しちゃう → kana: ちこくしてちゃう (wrong, should be ちこくしちゃう)
- 読んどいて → kana: よんでどいて (wrong, should be よんどいて)

## Affected entries
#46, #50, #259, #375, #378, #381, #383, #389, #391, #393, #401, #404, #406 — 11+ entries, scores 45-88

## Root cause
The compound kana builder concatenates the full (uncontracted) kana of each component. For contractions like ちゃう (from てしまう), the te-form component contributes its full って/て kana, and then ちゃう adds its own kana — resulting in って+ちゃう instead of just っちゃう.

## Suggested fix
In the CompoundWord kana generation (lookup.py around L480-510), detect contraction compounds and use the actual surface text's kana rather than concatenating component kana. The surface text IS the contracted form and its reading should match.

## Files to investigate
- himotoki/lookup.py — CompoundWord kana generation, make_compound()
- himotoki/suffixes.py — suffix compound creation
- himotoki/output.py — word_info_from_segment() kana field

## How to verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f "待ってても来ないならこっちから行っちゃおうか"
python -m himotoki -f "これ食べちゃっていい"
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore "50,391,404,406"
```

title: makuru suffix not registered (食べまくる, 飲みまくる = do relentlessly)
description:
## Problem

V-stem + まくる (to do over and over, relentlessly) is a productive suffix not registered in the suffix system.

## Failing Patterns

- 食べまくる (eat a lot) -> SPLITS as 食べ + まくる
- 飲みまくる (drink a lot) -> SPLITS as 飲み + まくる
- 走りまくる (run around a lot) -> SPLITS as 走り + まくる

All split as 2 separate words instead of showing as suffix compound.

## Root Cause

まくる is not registered in the suffix system. It attaches to the verb continuative stem.

Note: まくる is itself also a standalone verb (to turn up, to roll up). As a compound suffix (aux-v), it means "to do relentlessly/over and over". JMdict marks it as both v5r and aux-v.

## Fix Approach

1. Register makuru as suffix with continuative attachment:
   makuru_kf = get_kana_form(session, SEQ_MAKURU, 'まくる')
   _load_kf('ren', makuru_kf, suffix_class='makuru')

2. Add SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'makuru': 'to do ... over and over / relentlessly'

3. Handler: standard continuative stem lookup.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - new registration
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_MAKURU

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べまくる'
  python -m himotoki -f '飲みまくる'

title: となら merged instead of split into と+なら
description:
## Problem

Himotoki merges となら into a single token, while Ichiran correctly splits it into と (particle) + なら (conditional).

## Sentence
未来なんて誰にも分からないけど君となら歩いていける気がする

## Ichiran
未来 / なんて / 誰にも / 分からない / けど / 君 / と / なら / 歩いていける / 気がする

## Himotoki
未来 / なんて / 誰にも / 分からない / けど / 君 / となら / 歩いていける / 気がする

## Expected
と and なら should be separate tokens.

## How to Verify
python scripts/check_segments.py 23
close_reason: Fixed: Added となら seqs (11553382, 11566952) to SKIP_WORDS in lookup.py. Segmentation now correctly shows 君+と+なら as separate tokens. See commit 592aee9.

title: Suffix やがる not shown in chain display
description:
## Problem

食べやがる shows chain stopping at Continuative (たべ) — the やがる suffix is invisible.

## Current Output
  食べやがる → Continuative (~i) (たべ): and (stem)

## Expected Output
  食べやがる → Continuative (~i) (たべ) → やがる (indicates disdain)

## Root Cause

The suffix やがる is registered with handler 'teren' (suffixes.py ~L287). It should produce a compound word with やがる as a component. Likely the compound is being created but the display in _get_compound_display() doesn't render the やがる component properly - probably falls into the "else" branch at output.py ~L1697 and shows the kana but without the suffix description.

OR the compound word isn't being picked (same dict-vs-compound scoring issue as Issue 1).

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:287 - _load_conjs for yagaru
- himotoki/output.py:1697 - compound component display
- himotoki/suffixes.py:73 - SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION['yagaru']

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べやがる'
  python -m himotoki -f '食べやがった'

title: Feature: conjugation breakdown tree in default output
description:
## Summary

Add a conjugation breakdown tree to himotoki's default text output. When a word is conjugated (via DB conjugation chains or suffix compounds), show a step-by-step derivation tree with box-drawing characters, including the conjugation suffix and an English gloss at each step.

## Motivation

Currently, conjugation info is shown as a flat bracket notation:
```
[ Conjugation: [v1] Past (~ta) Negative Plain
  食べる【たべる】 ]
```

This doesn't show intermediate steps for multi-step conjugations like 食べられなかった (eaten + potential + negative + past). The user wants a tree:

```
食べられなかった【たべられなかった】 (Ichidan verb) <- 食べる【たべる】
  └─ passive/potential (られる): is done/can do
       └─ negative (ない): not
            └─ past (た): did
```

## Design Decisions (confirmed by user)

1. **Output mode**: Add to DEFAULT output (always shown for conjugated words)
2. **Scope**: Cover BOTH DB conjugation chains AND suffix compounds
3. **English glosses**: Include per-step English descriptions (e.g., "can do", "not", "did")

## Two Conjugation Mechanisms

### 1. DB Conjugation Chains (Conjugation.via)

Used for single inflected words like 食べられなかった. The `Conjugation` table has:
- `seq`: The conjugated entry
- `from_seq`: The root/dictionary entry
- `via`: Intermediate seq for secondary conjugations (e.g., passive form seq for passive+negative)

The `ConjProp` table stores type/neg/fml per conjugation step. The `ConjSourceReading` table maps conjugated text to source text at each step.

Key code path:
- `himotoki/lookup.py` L822-892: `get_conj_data()` - fetches ConjData objects
- `himotoki/lookup.py` L1951-1999: `_get_original_text_data_recursive()` - follows via chains (already walks the tree for scoring, but discards intermediate steps)
- `himotoki/db/models.py` L225-253: Conjugation model with `via` field

### 2. Suffix Compounds (CompoundWord.words)

Used for verb+suffix combinations like 食べている (eat + progressive). The `CompoundWord` class holds:
- `primary`: The main word (食べ)
- `words`: List of all component `WordMatch` objects [食べ, て, いる]

Key code path:
- `himotoki/lookup.py` L239-352: CompoundWord class
- `himotoki/output.py` L832-935: word_info_from_segment() for CompoundWord case
- `WordInfo.components`: List of component WordInfo objects (already populated)

## Implementation Plan

### Step 1: Add CONJ_STEP_GLOSSES to constants.py

Add English glosses for each conjugation type:
```python
CONJ_STEP_GLOSSES = {
    CONJ_NON_PAST: "does/is",
    CONJ_PAST: "did",
    CONJ_TE: "and/then",
    CONJ_PROVISIONAL: "if",
    CONJ_POTENTIAL: "can do",
    CONJ_PASSIVE: "is done (to)",
    CONJ_CAUSATIVE: "makes do",
    CONJ_CAUSATIVE_PASSIVE: "is made to do",
    CONJ_VOLITIONAL: "let's/will",
    CONJ_IMPERATIVE: "do!",
    CONJ_CONDITIONAL: "if/when",
    CONJ_ALTERNATIVE: "doing things like",
    CONJ_CONTINUATIVE: "and (stem)",
}
```

### Step 2: Add ConjStep dataclass to output.py

```python
@dataclass
class ConjStep:
    conj_type: str       # e.g., "Passive"
    suffix: str          # e.g., "られる"
    gloss: str           # e.g., "is done/can do"
    neg: bool = False
    fml: bool = False
```

### Step 3: New function build_conj_chain() in output.py

Walk the `Conjugation.via` chain to produce a list of `ConjStep` objects for DB-conjugated words. This is the KEY new logic:

1. Start with the word's conjugation IDs
2. Query `Conjugation` table -> get `ConjProp` (type) and `ConjSourceReading` (suffix text)
3. If `via` is not None, recursively query `Conjugation` where `seq = via` to get intermediate steps
4. Build ordered list of ConjStep from root outward

Reference: `_get_original_text_data_recursive()` at lookup.py L1951 already walks via chains but only returns text data. The new function needs to capture ConjProp at each step.

### Step 4: New function build_compound_steps() in output.py

For suffix compounds, iterate `WordInfo.components` and create ConjStep for each suffix component (everything after the primary word).

### Step 5: New function format_conj_breakdown() in output.py

Render the list of ConjSteps as a tree with box-drawing characters:
```
  └─ passive (られる): is done
       └─ negative (ない): not
            └─ past (た): did
```

Each level indents by 5 chars. Format: `└─ {type} ({suffix}): {gloss}`
Negative/formal modifiers prepend to type: "negative past" instead of just "past".

### Step 6: Add header line function

Format the header: `surface【reading】 (POS) <- source【source_reading】`
Only shown when conjugation data exists.

### Step 7: Integrate into format_word_info_text() in cli.py

After the existing conjugation bracket output (or replacing it), call:
```python
breakdown = build_conj_breakdown(session, wi)
if breakdown:
    lines.append(breakdown)
```

### Step 8: Integrate into segment_to_text() in output.py

Same integration as cli.py's format_word_info_text().

## Files to Change

| File | What Changes |
|------|-------------|
| `himotoki/constants.py` L95+ | Add `CONJ_STEP_GLOSSES` dict |
| `himotoki/output.py` L70+ | Add `ConjStep` dataclass |
| `himotoki/output.py` L1570+ | Add `build_conj_chain()`, `build_compound_steps()`, `format_conj_breakdown()`, `build_conj_breakdown()` |
| `himotoki/cli.py` L75-82 | Integrate breakdown into `format_word_info_text()` |
| `himotoki/output.py` L1555-1565 | Integrate breakdown into `segment_to_text()` |
| `tests/` | Add test for breakdown output |

## How to Verify

```bash
# Test with conjugated verb
echo "食べられなかった" | python -m himotoki

# Test with suffix compound
echo "食べている" | python -m himotoki

# Test with polite past
echo "行きました" | python -m himotoki

# Run tests
pytest tests/ -x --tb=short
```

## Expected Output Examples

```
食べられなかった【たべられなかった】 (Ichidan verb) <- 食べる【たべる】
  └─ passive/potential (られる): is done/can do
       └─ negative (ない): not
            └─ past (た): did

行きました【いきました】 (Godan verb) <- 行く【いく】
  └─ polite (ます): polite
       └─ past (た): did

食べている【たべている】 (compound)
  └─ 食べ: eat (te-form)
       └─ て: connective
            └─ いる: is doing (progressive)
```

title: rashii handler misses noun+rashii and verb-plain+rashii patterns
description:
## Problem

らしい is registered as a suffix and has a handler, but it only matches conj_type 2 (some specific conjugation type). It fails for:

- 男らしい (manly) -> dict entry, no chain (noun + rashii)
- 女らしい (womanly) -> dict entry, no chain
- 春らしい (spring-like) -> no parse
- 学生らしい (student-like) -> no parse
- 食べるらしい (apparently eats) -> multi-word split (食べる + らしい separate)

## Current Handler (suffixes.py L1260)

def _handler_rashii(root, suffix, kf):
    result1 = find_word_with_conj_type(session, root, 2)
    result2 = find_word_with_conj_type(session, root + 'ら', 11)
    return result1 + result2

This only finds words whose conjugated form matches the root with specific conj types.

## Root Cause

rashii attaches to:
1. Nouns: 男 + らしい, 春 + らしい, 学生 + らしい
2. Verb plain form: 食べる + らしい
3. Adj plain form: 高い + らしい
4. Na-adj stem: 静か + らしい

The handler doesn't try noun lookup at all. It needs:
  results.extend(find_word_with_pos(session, root, 'n'))

Also, for 男らしい and 女らしい, these are ALSO JMdict dict entries (seq 1420030 for 男らしい), so the dict-entry-hides-compound issue (himotoki-i346) applies too.

## Fix Approach

Expand _handler_rashii to also search:
  results.extend(find_word_with_pos(session, root, 'n'))
  results.extend(find_word_with_pos(session, root, 'adj-na'))
  results.extend(find_word_full(session, root))  # catches plain verb/adj forms

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py:1260 - _handler_rashii()
- himotoki/suffixes.py:459 - rashii registration
- himotoki/suffixes.py:888 - SUFFIX_SCORES rashii

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '男らしい'
  python -m himotoki -f '春らしい'
  python -m himotoki -f '学生らしい'

title: Enhancement: register missing te-form suffixes (miru, ageru, hoshii)
description:
## Problem

Three common te-form auxiliary verbs are not registered in the suffix system. They parse as separate words instead of as part of a compound, resulting in broken or missing chain display.

## Missing Suffixes

### 1. てみる (try doing) - HIGH frequency
- 食べてみる → chain shows only te-form, みる invisible
- 食べてみた → parsed as TWO words: 食べて + 見る (with kanji!)
- Should be a single compound with みる as suffix

### 2. てあげる (do for someone) - MEDIUM frequency
- 教えてあげる → chain shows only te-form, あげる invisible
- 教えてあげた → parsed as TWO words: 教えて + 上げる (with kanji!)
- Should be a single compound with あげる as suffix

### 3. てほしい (want someone to do) - MEDIUM frequency
- 来てほしい → chain shows only te-form, ほしい invisible
- Should be a single compound with ほしい as suffix

## Note

Ichiran (the reference implementation) also does not register these as suffixes. This is an ENHANCEMENT beyond the upstream feature set.

## Implementation

### suffixes.py - init_suffixes()

Add new constants and registrations:

```python
# In constants.py - add new SEQ constants:
SEQ_MIRU = <seq for 見る>
SEQ_AGERU = <seq for 上げる>  
SEQ_HOSHII = <seq for 欲しい>

# In suffixes.py - init_suffixes():
_load_conjs(session, 'te+space', SEQ_MIRU, suffix_class='miru')
_load_conjs(session, 'te+space', SEQ_AGERU, suffix_class='ageru')
_load_conjs(session, 'te+space', SEQ_HOSHII, suffix_class='hoshii')
```

### SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION additions:

```python
'miru': 'to try doing ...',
'ageru': 'to do (something) for someone',
'hoshii': 'want (someone) to do ...',
```

## How to Verify

```bash
python -m himotoki -f "食べてみる"   # Should show みる in chain
python -m himotoki -f "教えてあげる"  # Should show あげる in chain
python -m himotoki -f "来てほしい"   # Should show ほしい in chain
```

## Code Locations

- `himotoki/suffixes.py:230-280` - init_suffixes() suffix registrations
- `himotoki/suffixes.py:56-89` - SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION
- `himotoki/constants.py` - SEQ constants

title: Systemic: reading/kana errors across multiple patterns
description:
## Problem
Multiple reading/kana error patterns:

### 1. ず form appends ないず (e.g. 諦めず → あきらめないず)
Entries: #30, #187, #413, #424, #425, #437, #440, #451, #458, #464, #465, #485

### 2. Contracted forms have extra syllables 
- してた → していた (should be してた)
- なきゃ → しなければなきゃ (garbled)
- Entries: #32, #42, #47, #54, #294, #296

### 3. Spaces in compound readings
- 払ってくれれば → はらって くれれば (unexpected space)
- Entries: #26, #97

### 4. Context-dependent readings
- 入る → いる instead of はいる (#383, #477)
- 悪口 → あっこう instead of わるぐち (#380)
- 精霊 → しょうりょう instead of せいれい (#65)
- 市場 → いちば instead of しじょう (#95)

## Scale
Affects 66 of 172 failing entries.

## How to Verify
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore 30,187,380,477
notes: Fixed abbreviation readings by adding ABBREVIATION_STEMS dict in suffixes.py. ず/ねー/なきゃ forms now have correct readings

title: くらい suffix chain cuts off - label not shown
description:
## Problem

食べくらい shows the Continuative chain but くらい itself has no label in the display.

## Current Output
  食べくらい → ← 食べる | Continuative (~i) (たべ): and (stem)

## Expected
  食べくらい → ← 食べる | Continuative (~i) (たべ) → くらい (about/approximately)

## Root Cause

Same as the base-form suffix label issue (himotoki-z5js). The compound component for くらい is rendered as bare kana without the SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION. The description 'about/approximately' exists but get_suffix_description() is not called.

This is a duplicate of himotoki-z5js (suffix descriptions not shown). Will be fixed when that issue is resolved.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/output.py:1697 - bare kana display
- himotoki/suffixes.py:62 - SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION for kurai exists

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '食べくらい'

title: cha contraction reading: 食べちゃいけない romanized as tabeha
description:
## Problem
When ちゃ (contraction of ては) appears in words like 食べちゃいけない, the romanization 
shows the underlying form "ha" instead of the surface pronunciation "cha".

## Examples
```
$ python -m himotoki -f '食べちゃいけない'
tabeha ikenai  ← "ha" instead of "cha"

* tabeha  食べちゃ 【たべは】  ← reading shows は not ちゃ
  └─ Conjunctive (~te) (て)
       └─ は (topic marker particle)
```

Surface form is ちゃ (pronounced "cha") but reading says たべは (tabewa/tabeha).
Similarly: 食べちゃだめ → tabeha dame

## Expected
Reading should be 【たべちゃ】 / romanized as "tabecha" since that's the actual pronunciation.

## Root Cause
When ちゃ is decomposed to て+は, the reading generation uses the は reading instead of
preserving the ちゃ surface reading. The grammatical analysis is correct (て+は) but
the reading should match the surface form.

## Code Locations
- himotoki/output.py - reading/romanization generation for contracted forms
- May need special handling for ちゃ/じゃ contractions of ては/では

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -r '食べちゃいけない'
# Should show: tabecha ikenai (not tabeha ikenai)
```

description:
Entry #391 (score 28.0)

Issues:
- The kana for '行らなきゃ' is hallucinated as 'やらなければなきゃ'.
- The token 'よ' is incorrectly identified as an 'Adjective Stem' with the source text 'いい' (it is a sentence-ending partic

title: Bug: compound words missing seq/POS/conjugation metadata (null fields)
description:
## Problem
Many multi-word compounds end up with null values for seq, POS, and conjugation fields despite being analyzable verb forms. Examples:
- 止めてた — null seq, null conj_type, null pos
- 持ってきてください — null seq, empty POS, no conjugation
- 借りたい — no POS tags
- 開いてしまった — null seq, not marked as is_compound
- 入ってて — no POS, no source_text

## Affected entries
#55 (82), #74 (65), #145 (85), #183 (75), #271 (75), #382 (75), #383 (75), #390 (45), #399 (45), #405 (60), #425 (82) — 11 entries

## Root cause
When word_info_from_segment() handles CompoundWord objects, it correctly sets is_compound=true and populates components. However:
1. If conj_data is empty in segment.info AND CompoundWord.get_conjugation_info() returns nothing, all conj fields stay null
2. The POS of the primary word is not propagated to the compound's POS field
3. Longer compounds (3+ components like 持ってきてください) often have no conj_data at all

## Suggested fix
In himotoki/output.py word_info_from_segment() (CompoundWord branch, ~L832-935):
1. Always populate POS from the primary word's entry
2. For compounds with no conj_data, derive conjugation info from the component chain
3. Ensure seq is set from the primary word even when conj_data is empty

## Files to investigate
- himotoki/output.py L832-935 — word_info_from_segment() CompoundWord branch
- himotoki/lookup.py L300-350 — CompoundWord.get_conjugation_info()

## How to verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -j "止めてたっぽい" | python -m json.tool
python -m himotoki -j "持ってきてください" | python -m json.tool
python scripts/llm_eval.py --rescore "55,183,271,382"
```

title: Fix なんて expression splitting
description:
## Issue

Himotoki incorrectly splits the expression なんて (such things as / things like) into separate morphemes.

## Example

**Sentence**: 明日までにレポートを提出させられるなんてもっと早く言ってくれればよかったのに

### Ichiran (Correct)
```
明日         → あした         [n,adv]
まで         → まで          [prt]
に          → に           [prt]
レポート       → レポート        [n,vs,vt]
を          → を           [prt]
提出させられる    → ていしゅつさせられる  [Potential] ← させる
なんて        → なんて         [adj-f,adv]  ✓ CORRECT: kept as expression
もっと        → もっと         [adv]
早く         → はやく         [adv]
言ってくれれば    → いってくれれば     [Provisional] ← 呉れる
よかった       → よかった        [Past] ← いい
のに         → のに          [prt]
```

### Himotoki (Incorrect)
```
明日         → あした         [n,adv]
まで         → まで          [prt]
に          → に           [prt]
レポート       → レポート        [n,vs,vt]
を          → を           [prt]
提出させられるな   → ていしゅつ させられるな  [Imperative] ← させる  ✗ WRONG conjugation
ん          → ん           [int]  ✗ SPLIT
て          → て           [prt]  ✗ SPLIT
もっと        → もっと         [adv]
早く         → はやく         [adv]
言ってくれれば    → いってくれれば     [Provisional] ← 呉れる
よかった       → よかった        [Past] ← いい
のに         → のに          [prt]
```

## Root Cause

Himotoki is incorrectly analyzing:
- 提出させられる + なんて as 提出させられるな + ん + て
- This changes the meaning from 'being made to submit things like...' to 'Don't make me submit!'

## Expected Behavior

なんて should be recognized as a single expression meaning 'such things as' or 'things like'.

## Problem

Sentence: 雨降りそうだから傘持ってった方がいいかもよ

Sentence: 推し活にお金使いすぎて今月ピンチもやし生活確定だわ

### #444 (score 75): もまず misparse

Bug: もまず parsed as negative of 揉む (to rub) instead of も + まず (adverb)
Fix: Boost common adverb まず when preceded by particle も

### #425 (score 82): ものだね false match
Sentence: 類は友を呼ぶと言う通り似た者同士は自然と集まるものだね
Bug: ものだね matched to 物種 (seed/cause) instead of もの + だ + ね
Fix: 物種 is archaic/rare — penalize its score or require kanji spelling


title: で particle misidentified as copula conjunctive
description:
## Problem

Case particle で (location/means) is being incorrectly identified as the conjunctive (~te) form of copula だ.

## Examples

コンビニで - location (at convenience store), not copula
カラオケで - location (at karaoke), not copula  
電車で - means (by train), not copula

## Affected entries

#52, #53, #58 (and likely many more)

## Root Cause

The parser is matching で to the copula だ conjugation pattern instead of recognizing it as a standalone case particle.

## Fix

Improve disambiguation in lookup.py - when で follows a noun, prefer case particle interpretation.

title: au compound verb suffix not registered (食べ合う, 教え合う = do together)
description:
## Problem
合う (au) as a productive compound verb suffix meaning "do mutually / together" is not 
registered. When the specific V+合う form is not a dict entry, it splits.

## Examples
- 食べ合う → tabe au (SPLIT - no dict entry)
- 教え合う → oshie au (SPLIT - no dict entry)
- 助け合う → tasukeau (OK - dict entry)
- 話し合う → hanashiau (OK - dict entry)

## Root Cause
合う is not registered as a compound verb suffix. Common V+合う combinations are in the 
dictionary but productive forms split. This is similar to other unregistered compound verb 
suffixes (dasu, kiru, etc. in existing issues).

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - add au compound verb handler
- Attaches after verb masu-stems

## How to Verify
```bash
python -m himotoki -f '食べ合う'
# Should show chain: 食べる → 合う (reciprocal/mutual)
python -m himotoki -f '教え合う'
# Should show chain: 教える → 合う
```

title: ppoi suffix not registered (忘れっぽい, 子供っぽい, etc.)
description:
## Problem

Words with っぽい suffix show no grammar chain. The suffix is NOT registered in suffixes.py at all.

## Failing Patterns

- 忘れっぽい (forgetful) -> dict entry only, no chain
- 飽きっぽい (easily bored) -> dict entry only
- 怒りっぽい (hot-tempered) -> dict entry only
- 子供っぽい (childish) -> dict entry only
- 大人っぽい (adult-like) -> dict entry only

## Root Cause

ppoi is not in the suffix system. It is not in SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION, not in SUFFIX_HANDLERS, and has no _handler_ppoi function. All these words exist as JMdict entries, so they get parsed as dict entries with no grammar chain.

ppoi attaches to:
- Verb continuative stem: 忘れ + っぽい, 飽き + っぽい
- Nouns: 子供 + っぽい, 大人 + っぽい, 水 + っぽい

The っ is a geminate (doubling) of the stem-final consonant before ぽい.

## Fix Approach

1. Register ppoi as a suffix in init_suffixes():
   Find JMdict seq for っぽい (likely an i-adjective suffix entry)
   _load_conjs(session, 'ppoi', SEQ_PPOI)

2. Add handler _handler_ppoi() that:
   - Strips っぽい from the word
   - Tries verb continuative: find_word_with_conj_type(root, CONJ_CONTINUATIVE)
   - Tries noun: find_word_with_pos(root, 'n')

3. Add to SUFFIX_DESCRIPTION:
   'ppoi': '-ish / tends to / apt to'

4. Add to SUFFIX_SCORES

## Code Locations
- himotoki/suffixes.py - needs new registration, handler, description
- himotoki/constants.py - add SEQ_PPOI

## How to Verify
  python -m himotoki -f '忘れっぽい'
  python -m himotoki -f '子供っぽい'
